Description: Godin Exit 22 with a 24.75 scale (Gibson Like w fairly flat radius) two Single coils and a quality Full Humbucker P'Up ALL 3 Actual Godin's Premier Line and balanced tonally. 5 position selector switch a well rounded solid guitar allowing for an wide spectrum of sounds. Am Thinning my Collection please see my Godin's and other Strats This guitar is in really good condition not quite excellent. Since pictures I replaced the little black locking strap buttons with Full Size quality chrome over strap ones Power Guitar with wide tonal range.. Really good cond. Some small scuffs on front and back, Neck is near perfect with very little if any fret wear. All Edging on bouts and headstock without dings. ALL Pickups play great. std. Godin Labeled issue Set up is good, but NOT real low it's for Rock or blues string bending. Unplugged Tone is Outstanding on these models with solid machined block strings through body and Heavier Body It's a heavier than strat guitar but not Les Paul weight. I'm guessing just over 8 lbs? See Specs: Combines a 24-3/4' scale with a 22-fret neck. With the neck bolted deeper into the the body by an extra-fret, you get a bigger sound on the Godin Exit 22 while retaining an extremely comfortable feel and balance thanks to the short scale and sculpted, heelless neck joint. Monstrous distortion tones are easily dialed in via the bridge-position humbucker and stinging clean sounds are at your fingertips thanks to the single-coils in the neck and middle position. The electric guitar's solid mahogany body and rock maple neck have a semi-gloss finish for a sleek feel. FEATURES Rock maple neck Mahogany body Godin-design pickups Single-coil, single-coil, humbucker configuration 5-way switch Volume and tone controls Fixed bridge 12" fingerboard radius 24-3/4" scale Exit 22 Top Nut: Tusq by Graphtech Nut width: 1 11/16" Scale: 24 ¾" Radius: 12" Tuners: Godin high ratio sealed tuners String gauge: Godin Nickel electric strings 9-46 Frets: Medium Nickel Pickups: Hum/single/single Godin pickups Where many guitars tend to excel specifically for distortion or clean tones the Exit 22 can handle both with incredible ease and dynamics. Monstrous distortion tones are easily dialed in via the aggressive Godin bridge humbucker and stinging clean tones are also at your fingertips thanks to the Godin single coil pickups in the middle and neck position. Alternapop/Full/Round tone Position: 1 lower tone for a warmer sound Modern Blues/Bell like tones for chord vamps and fat solos Position: 2 Lower tone slightly for extra "dirt" Country Lead/stinging and tight Position: 3 Funky/R&B/Full sound but still cuts through Position: 4 Hard rock/Aggressive tone Position: 5 Godin GSN-1 Godin GS-1 Godin GHB-1 “A” “B” “D” “C” Pos.“1” Pos.“5” Tone Volume Exit 22 Custom Godin Pickups Pos. 1 - A Pos. 2 - A,B Pos. 3 - B Pos. 4 - B,C,D Pos. 5 - C,D
